newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end low amid surplus funds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end low amid surplus funds.

text.p: Pakistan's money rates ended low on Saturday amid surplus funds and dealers said next week's trend would depend on the results of a special open market operation (OMO) by the central bank.

"Lenders initially offered funds at 12 and 15 percent. But yesterday's liquid close made overnight borrowers seek funds in single digits and deals were struck at around 6.0 percent in the morning session," one dealer said.
Later rates dropped further and most deals were struck at 2.0 to 4.0 percent, he said.
